intro: Heisteria pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific heister, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Heisteria pacifica is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
